intro: Dubyaea bhotanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese dubyaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bhutan. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring and summer months, producing clusters of vibrant purple or red flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Dubyaea bhotanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
